attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: Allow the summer 2019 gcse literature exam paper to be open book. (For quotes)
attributes.background: The current upcoming summer exam papers for gcse literature is a closed book test - and while this has been petitioned before, there are a few specific - yet vital - points that the government failed to discuss during their conclusion...
attributes.additional_details: The government responded, stating that the exam boards supply the candidate with a relevant extract to the question; while this is the case, the candidate is capped at 15 marks out of 30 if they do not mention somewhere else in the play - relevant to the question. This, in turn, means that they will require to memorise various sections of the play (or novel) just so that they can get more than half marks on the question. Getting half marks overall is a current grade 4 which is not even a pass.

attributes.action: Remove compulsory GCSE English and maths resits for 16-18 year olds students
attributes.background: Compulsory GCSE resits do not apply to Apprentices or T Level students who may be enrolled on Functional Skills. Teachers should be allowed to select the most appropriate type of English and maths qualification for a students' onward progression, rather than being mandated by a Condition of Funding
attributes.additional_details: Government must change this failed and costly policy which shows that three-quarters of young people who failed to achieve a GCSE in English and maths at age 16, have still not achieved them by age 19 despite multiple attempts. FE professionals should be allowed to choose the most appropriate qualification linked to a student's intended destination. The AoC, AELP, and ASCL have called for the policy to be scrapped, with Ofsted stating that there are "serious questions" about it. Let's change it!

attributes.action: Establish a special unit to tackle the misconduct of public officials.
attributes.background:
Abuse of the public's trust has become normalised: it is simply accepted as the way things are and not treated as the criminal offence that it is.
The police cannot get involved in political decisions and for this reason have proven too cautious over this offence, hence the need for a special unit.
attributes.additional_details:
Taking the nation to war on a lie or rending the nation asunder with a promise that there is no intention of keeping are serious abuses of the public's trust, or at least they appear so to me. 

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/misconduct-public-office

Too often we hear tales of public officers abusing their powers to line their pockets or conceal their wrongdoings, yet we almost never hear of these things being investigated. This need to stop.

attributes.action: Protect hundreds of thousands of savers by preserving NS&I's use of the RPI
attributes.background: Reverse Treasury-backed NS&I's decision to switch the formula for increasing its index-linked savings certificate from the RPI to the CPI from May 2019 – and protect half a million pensioners' incomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 500,000 people hold NS&I's index-linked savings certificates. From May 2019 NS&I is switching its measure of inflation from the retail prices index to the consumer prices index.
This will lower the interest the certificates pay as CPI is usually lower. NS&I says the switch is in line with Government policy. Yet rail fares and student loans increase with RPI. The Government should honour the original terms of the certificates until such a time as taxpayer costs are also increased with CPI.

attributes.action: The Saudi Arabian Ambassador should be expelled.
attributes.background: The Saudi armed forces are attacking Yemen with bad reconnaissance. The result is the large scale killing of innocent civilians. The Saudi authorities permit this situation to perpetuate.
attributes.additional_details: At least 29 children have been killed and 30 wounded in a Saudi-led coalition air strike in Yemen, the International Committee of the Red Cross says. The children were travelling on a bus that was hit at a market in Dahyan, in the northern province of Saada. The health ministry run by the rebel Houthi movement put the death toll at 43, and said 61 people were wounded. The coalition, which is backing Yemen's government in a war with the Houthis, said its actions were "legitimate".

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders being held at Hollesley Bay prison
attributes.background: Hollesley bay is an open prison with a public access road right through its grounds. There is a primary school within a 4 minute walk and areas open to the public where people take their children to play.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that food labels must state exactly which ingredients they contain
attributes.background:
There have been several high profile cases of allergies causing death where the food labelling has not been correct.

Those with allergies can't eat a vast range of food due to the labels stating 'may contain'. For example, may contain nuts... Which nuts? Actual ingredients only should be listed.

attributes.action: Change the rules on accessibility to schools to match that of planning.
attributes.background: Planning applications are judged as being accessible when within a walking distance of 2km and cycling distance of 5km to amenities.  The rules for school children should match this.  This should mean safe cycle routes for a significant amount of the current 3 mile walking distance.
attributes.additional_details:
To walk 3miles takes about an hour, whilst cycling this distance would take about 20 minutes. This reduces the amount of time children have at home to study or attend extra curricular activities.
If walking upto 2km for adults is suitable then how can the government justify the 3miles(5km) for children as young as 11?
We would like the rules changed so that those traveling upto 3 miles will have a safe cycle route most of the distance and be able to travel with a cycle the rest of the way.

attributes.action: All children's bicycles sold in the UK to have handlebar plugs fitted.
attributes.background: Children are injured, and even killed, by the handlebars of their own bikes. These deaths are preventable. I would like to update British Standards. Initially through an immediate voluntary action and then into BS EN 16054 (BMX) & BS EN ISO 8098 (childrens').
attributes.additional_details: Bicycle handlebar trauma has been well documented in children. Spleen, liver, pancreatic lacerations and renal injuries are the most commonly traumatized sites. Other reported injuries are traumatic abdominal wall hernias and ruptures, aortic rupture, transection of the common bile duct, traumatic arterial occlusion, and groin injuries Presumably, the handlebar of a typical child's bicycle acts as a spear, concentrating what may be a relatively small amount of energy into a focal point of injury.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Holiday firms to increase prices in school holidays
attributes.background:
Parents who take children on unauthorised term-time holidays cannot escape fines and criminal records.
The right to affordable holidays is being taken away by the system.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of parents arround the country  face a choice each year. Do they take their children out of school to go on a cheaper holidays.  Holiday prices during the School term are significantly cheaper than when taken during  official school holidays.
The government should look to ensure holidays during official holiday periods are affordable for all.
Safeguards should be legally put in place to prevent holidays firms over-inflating prices during key holiday periods.

attributes.action: Form a mandatory regulatory body for undertakers
attributes.background: When our daughter died, we visited the funeral director and were treated with a total lack of respect, and left in tears and angry at the lowest point of our lives. There are two trade associations for funeral directors, however it is not mandatory that they are members.
attributes.additional_details: The funeral director showed us no respect. His dog was yapping around our ankles, he kept answering his phone whilst we were trying to talk to him about our daughter’s funeral, at one point his wife even shouted into the room to give him an update on another funeral. My husband and son walked out, and when I told him we were grieving parents, his argument was that he was really busy at the moment. These are things that no person who has lost a loved one should have to go through.

attributes.action: Scrap the approval of doubling the immigration health surcharge for nurses!
attributes.background: With the parliament approving the proposal to double the payment from £200 to £400 per year per individual applicant for Immigration Health Surcharge requirement, it puts another burden to the health and social care sector nurse immigrants from non-eu trained nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
UK is already struggling with recruiting nurses both locallu and internationally, putting the IHS twice the cost makes it even harder. 

Exempting nurses with the current increase can help address the issue with recruiting nurses.

attributes.action: Overturn a Home Office decision regarding a Kidney Donor who was refused a visa
attributes.background:
Gulfraz Ahmed, 33 of Luton is in need of a life saving kidney transplant.

Throughout his life he has suffered many serious health issues. By the age of 12 both his kidney's had deteriorated. His mother had provided a life saving kidney donor at the time, which has so far kept him going until now.
attributes.additional_details:
Gulfraz's only kidney has now deteriorated to the point he requires dialyses 3 times a week. This is costing the NHS £50,000 a year.

Gulfraz's family have found a match after extensive tests in Pakistan. All that is required is a 6 months visa to accommodate this transplant.

However the application has been refused by the Home Office.

We are seeking the Home Office to display compassion on the grounds to save a young successful business man's life. Sadly this is a matter of life or death.

attributes.action: Action a NO DEAL Brexit and give divorce bill savings directly to UK citizens
attributes.background: This could give a significant boost to the economy as many people would spend it. The Exchequer would therefore receive VAT receipts. Under 18 year olds could have the funds placed in an ISA until they reach the age of 18.
attributes.additional_details: The current estimate of the divorce bill is £40 billion.

attributes.action: FA2017 Part 2 Clause 29(2) to include calorific maltodextrin
attributes.background: Calorific maltodextrin has high GI but not included as sugars. Consumers are misled as to amount of sugars in drinks where glycemic maltodextrin not included.  Sugar drinks levy should take account of all glycemic carbohydrates

attributes.action: Uplift pensioners £10 Xmas Bonus (as it was in 1972) to £25 & link to inflation
attributes.background: In 1972 the Xmas bonus was introduced at a respectable £10, enough for a good Xmas family dinner. 46 years on and it is still £10, enough for half a chicken, a few potatoes and a splash of gravy. If the bonus was index linked to inflation, it would be worth an equally respectable £128 today.
attributes.additional_details: Some £150 million of ‘festive bonuses’ was shared among 15 million people last year, although many may not have noticed. While any contribution is of course welcome, surely it is time to increase the bonus to at least £25 and start linking the payment to inflation.

attributes.action: Require political parties to have robust procedures for tackling discrimination
attributes.background: Traditionally, British political parties are regulated only by the electorate, apart from basic rules on matters such as campaign funding which are enforced by the Electoral Commission. There are no rules against discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
It is clear that political parties are not trusted to deal with discrimination themselves. For example, our polling has found that 92% of British Jews feel that UK political parties tolerate antisemitism.

The law should require political parties to have fair, efficient and transparent procedures for tackling discrimination amongst members, or the parties should face substantial fines.

Political parties should be obliged to meet a minimum requirement for tackling discrimination of all forms, including antisemitism, based on the Campaign Against Antisemitism’s guidance at https://antisemitism.uk/politics/manifesto.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for domesticated cats and dogs to be spayed/neutered.
attributes.background: Not spaying/neutering pets has caused shelters to be full to capacity.,therefore there are many strays and feral animals on the streets, struggling  to survive with little help.

attributes.action: Pass a law that only allows the sale of Quiet Fireworks to the general public.
attributes.background: Loud Fireworks can cause anxiety and distress to Animals, Elderly, Vunerable and Veterans. Fireworks are allowed to be 120 decibels, equivalent to a jet aircraft taking off. We want this reduced to 97 decibels, equivalent to a car door slamming, and only allowing anything above at public displays
attributes.additional_details:
Animals: Many animals find the noise from Fireworks scary. They become confused and panic.Many fleeing away from the noise causing injury to themselves.
Elderly: Are frequently scared and intimidated by Firework noises causing anxiety and distress.
The Vunerable: I.E Autistic Children can find the loud bangs distressing and frightening and incredibly overwhelming 
Dementia Sufferers: Can become distressed and agitated causing heightened Anxiety and Stress.
War Veterans: Can effect ones with PTSD

attributes.action: Diagnosed mental health patients should receive free prescriptions
attributes.background: Without medication mental health patients can die, they are three times more likely to develop additional physical problems such as diabetes, heart disease and addictions, all of which can reduce life expectancy.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental illness is considered a disability, question behaviour, whether stable and/or taking medication. 
Mind organisation have already researched the definition and terms of disability in conjunction with the Equality Act, 2010. Mental health is included. 
Diagnosed mental health problems should qualify an individual for free prescriptions in the same way as some medical conditions and physical disabilities.

attributes.action: Give free 3 rounds of IVF on the NHS to anyone under 40 that needs help
attributes.background: Going through fertility treatment is hard enough it puts a strain on your mental health & on your relationship. So as you can imagine having to fight to get IVF treatment on the NHS is an added unnecessary stress.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my partner has a child from a past relationship I’m penalised for it even tho it’s me that has the problem. I know a lot of women will be in the same situation with no where to turn so I want to change this stupid law.

The NICE guidelines state that women under 40 should be entitled to free 3 rounds of IVF yet the CCG have the final say where the majority only offer 1 round free. 

Let’s stop this postcode lottery
Let’s get the law changed
Let’s stop unnecessary suffering 
Let’s not forget Equal rights
Let’s make a change

attributes.action: Build all M53 bridges with anti climb fencing
attributes.background: All bridges crossing the M53 should have new fences built across them so people are unable to climb up and over them.
attributes.additional_details: How many more lives must be lost or risked because motorway bridges are built with fences that can be climbed? This is happening all too often and is so easily preventable.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to advertise domestic pets free to good home on social media
attributes.background: Every day there are adverts for dogs and cats going free to a good home, more often than not a lady and gent turn up all smartly dressed but they are just the suppliers for those that train their dogs to fight in illegal dog fights. This has to stop, these individuals have a constant supply of bait
attributes.additional_details: Bedsforbullies rescue pick up the pieces of just some of the lucky ones who have escaped. Prime example is Della a 10 year old bull terrier who was once a very loved family pet who was given away or sold off and she ended up in the hands of these evil people, she escaped and was found by a policeman called Derek who contacted bedsforbullies to help with Della. She had horrific facial and body injuries where she had been savaged by fighting dogs. No charges were ever brought.

attributes.action: Add the blood test for 22q to the Guthrie test 'heel prick' newborn screening.
attributes.background: My daughter has 22q11.2, she's historically been failed by clinicians, educational practitioners/institutions, social care and society in the wider context. Despite my concerns, late diagnosis at 4y6m, has impacted on her self esteem, language, social, emotional, mental health and life chances.
attributes.additional_details: Max Appeal is the UK charity that supports those affected. According to the All-Party Parliamentary Group, 22q11 could be the most common genetic disorder. 1 in 500 of the population has been reported, this would be 2x Down Syndrome, 6x Cystic Fibrosis. They found Mental health difficulties affect 93% of people with 22q11and it's the single most common cause of schizophrenia which affects 25% of people with 22q11. Delays in diagnosis has an adverse affect on the child, their family and it's also a hidden cost for the NHS, social services and welfare state.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis among young women and doctors
attributes.background: On average it takes 7.5 years for a woman to be diagnosed with endometriosis, this is often due to being told “it’s just bad menstrual cramps” or can be totally miss diagnosed. This is due to the education about the chronic illness.
attributes.additional_details: Statistic found from -https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/endometriosis-facts-and-figures

attributes.action: Childrens social workers to be mental health awareness trained and SEN trained
attributes.background:
Children are ending up in care wrongly, as front line social workers are not equipped with mental health awareness training or SEN trained. 
Reports on emotional harm are written wrongly, resulting children end up in care with complex needs and challenges that are not met until they leave care.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 Children and young people suffer with mental health issues. Though it still seems to be over looked in Childrens social work. They often lack  to correctly identify  a bullied child, a grieving child or child struggling at school because of SEN needs. Families are being split up because of lack of basic training that should be mandatory at University level with a yearly review in the work place.

attributes.action: End Business Improvement Districts: Stop this unfair Stealth Tax
attributes.background:
Stop unfair Stealth Tax 
A Business Improvement District (BID) is a defined area within which Businesses are forced to pay an additional TAX /LEVY. Traders have little or no control how this money collected by Councils on top of Business Tax is spent. This unfair legislation needs to be abolished.
attributes.additional_details:
BIDs are being allowed to creep in via undemocratic ballots. Central Government gives financial backing only to those wanting to establish a BID. This ignores and/or undermines any attempt at a NO campaign.

The Ministry of Communities, House and Local Government BID regulations are woefully inadequate and have allowed a culture of lack of BID accountability and transparency to run rife throughout the UK with no independent regulator.

attributes.action: Change how Universal Credit is calculated for those receiving student income
attributes.background: Currently student income is deducted pound for pound as though it’s unpaid income. It should be treated the same as earned income and deducted 63p in the pound. Calculations should also be changed for Scottish students who receive monthly student income payments and can have no payments over summer.
attributes.additional_details: Many lone parent students, indeed any student, can find themselves in a position where they are up to £300 a month worse off under UC than under tax credits because of the current guidance on student income. We take out student loans out to fund our education to help us get to a position where we no longer require in work benefits and instead of being encouraged we are penalised. They don’t acknowledge bank loans as income so why are student loans deducted so harshly for calculation purposes!

attributes.action: Grant tourist Visa-free access for UK to citizens of the Republic of Macedonia
attributes.background: Since January 2010 the citizens of the Republic of Macedonia were granted a Visa-free access to the Schengen area countries. We think that the United Kingdom needs to fallow the example set from the EU countries and the allow the Macedonian citizens a visa-free entry for tourism purposes in the UK.

attributes.action: Put Defibrillator awareness on a TV advert.
attributes.background:
It would be great to spread the awareness of how a Defibrillator is used and how it works. A lot of people are not aware that anyone can use a Defibrillator and that they don’t need to be first aid trained to use one. 
What a better way in telling the nation how AED’s work than showing them on TV.
attributes.additional_details:
As a first aid trainer, I understand people don’t understand what a defibrillator is and how it works. 
In the past, there has been an advert created for CPR with Vinnie Jones, with staying alive song.  This was a huge hit to get awareness of getting people how it important It is to do something and how to perform cpr correctly. 
Running first aid courses, 80% of learners have no idea how an AED works.

attributes.action: Abolish TV Licence
attributes.background: A lot of people forced to pay for a TV Licence and they are not watching BBC on live broadcast or online. TV Licence was founded when the BBC was the only broadcast channels, right now there is a lot of other channels to watch on TV so why do we have to keep paying if we are not watching BBC?

attributes.action: Ban any planning/ development on green belt, even in 'exceptional circumstances'
attributes.background: Successive Gts have failed to plan for UK future housing need. Local (housing) plans require local authorities to plan for future housing plans in that area. Authorities are offered huge financial incentives. Gmt targets are unrealistic and 220,000+ homes are currently planned for the green belt.
attributes.additional_details:
12.4% of UK is GB.
Landowners offered ££ to sell. 
Gmt housing targets fantasy, touting need for 'affordable housing', (80% of current market rent). LA's offered ££ to overbuild through 'new'/ 'affordable' homes bonuses. 
30m people live around GB. 30,000km of public rights of way. 250kha quality agricultural land. 89000ha SSSI.
220000ha mixed woodland. 
We say:
Review new homes targets. 
Brownfield not green belt.
No new homes bonuses.
Cease all current/ future plans to develop the green belt.

attributes.action: This Government must financially support the Moorside project.
attributes.background: The future of the proposed new build nuclear power station at Moorside in Copeland is at risk. We are calling for the Government to underwrite Moorside and secure its future. No nuclear power station anywhere in the world has ever been built without government help.

attributes.action: We want Britain to give more help and treatment for people with a Pineal Cyst
attributes.background: Sadly Great Britain does not acknowledge symptomatic Pineal Cysts as other countries do. This leaves sufferers with awful symptoms and no offer of the much needed surgery to help them. This needs to change to allow sufferers to live their lives free from pain.
attributes.additional_details:
Some common symptoms of a pineal cyst can be
* Constant headaches
* vomiting and nausea
* weakness and loss of feeling in one side
* abnormal eye movement and blurriness in vision
* changes in memory and personality
* changes in speech
* drowsiness and seizures
* increased anxiety
* constant fatigue
Other countries offer surgery to remove the cyst but we want more help and support in this country so people don't have to go abroad for help at the cost of tens of thousands of pounds.

attributes.action: Lower the maximum temperature allowed when transporting livestock after Brexit
attributes.background:
EU rules require the ability to keep the temperature under 35°C in the animal compartment, when transporting livestock on journeys over eight hours. 

35°C is inhumane and does not cover shorter journeys. There is also no guarantee of protection for livestock after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Current EU guidance: 
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/farm-animal-welfare-during-transportation#eu-regulation-on-the-welfare-of-animals-in-transport

attributes.action: We call on the government to fund a new NHS A&E Hospital for West Herts NOW.
attributes.background: NHS Improvement and DHSC have reviewed West Herts Hospital Trust's Strategic Outline Case for hospital redevelopment and advised them to come up with a more affordable scheme whilst admitting the Trust's hospital buildings need improving, particularly those at Vicarage Road.(a slight understatement)
attributes.additional_details: WHHT admit that it would take at least £600 million to redevelop Watford General Hospital-The Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Birmingham was built for £545 million and has twice the number of beds! Major redevelopment of West Herts' hospitals would not only take more than a decade to complete but incur considerable inconvenience and disruption and not be the best long-term solution. (WH's pop. expected to grow by 150 000 in the next 15 years)  NOW IS THE TIME TO FUND A NEW A&E HOSPITAL FOR WEST HERTS.

attributes.action: Amend the 2004 Hunting Act to include a minimum age requirement for hunt riders.
attributes.background: A child witnessing a fox killed by hounds during trail hunting has a psychological impact. It can be detrimental to their mental health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
A minimum age of 16 years old for riders with trail hunts is required. The accidental but brutal killing of an animal should never be witnessed by a minor.

Trail hunts can kill foxes. Regardless of whether a hunt chases and kills foxes intentionally or by accident, this is no place for a child. Children as young as 5 or 6 ride out on hunts. They are innocent and unaware of the intent of the hounds should they get on the scent of a fox. To witness such a violent act at a young age could normalise abusive behaviour and create an acceptance of animal cruelty.

attributes.action: Publish all official documents surrounding Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: The British public found out in 2001, via secret documents released under the 30 year rule, they'd had information withheld prior to EEC accession. Make the UK Prime Minister publish all communications & dealings surrounding the EU & Brexit negotiations so that the British public can know the truth.
attributes.additional_details:
Secret documents that show the British public had vital information withheld from them include the following:

Document Reference: FCO 30/1048
(Last available here - http://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/r/C11018818)

Document Reference: FCO 30/789 
Foreign Office - 9th November 1970
(Last available here - http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/documents/nyo_2001.pdf)
Document Reference: CAB 164/771 
Giscard and Rippon - 24th November 1970

attributes.action: Guaranteed help at A&E to prevent avoidable deaths from suicide
attributes.background: When you feel suicidal in the UK, doctors tell you to go to A&E. What you will find there is based on luck: will you find compassion? Or will you be judged and turned away? A majority of the time, the latter. Asking for help can be a turning point for individuals in crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be a nation-wide, guaranteed response to individuals seeking help for suicidal thoughts and feelings in our hospitals. 
 
The following procedure should be guaranteed as a standard response: 
 
1. The contemplation of suicide or signs of severe mental distress is classified as a medical emergency. 
2. The individual is processed on-site immediately. 
3. The individual is taken to a “Calm Room”. 
4. ‘Suicide Guarantee’ trained staff member speaks with the individual with attentive compassion. 
5. A specialist professional involves the individual in creating a written plan to assure their immediate safety and ongoing treatment and/or support.

attributes.action: Raise the profile of menopause in the public domain
attributes.background: Menopause affects half the population at some point in their lives, but menopause is often not acknowledged, taken seriously or knowledgably by Health Care Professionals. As many women are now employed and work for longer, greater awareness is needed to be more healthy and productive for longer.
attributes.additional_details: Provide more awareness and clarity on menopause through leaflets at Health Care Providers, emphasising that it's not just hot flushes that signal menopause. Target women in their 40s, 50s and 60s to cover all stages of menopause. Many women on contraceptives such as the mini-pill or the coil do not menstruate so need guidance. Integrate the information into the NHS website so that if you search for subjects such as memory loss, tiredness, anxiety etc. it states menopause as a possible cause.

attributes.action: HM Government must publish the legal advice on Brexit immediately
attributes.background: HM Government has received legal advice on its Brexit 'deal' but is refusing to make this public in spite of HM Opposition tabling a Humble Address on the matter. This is a very serious breach of parliamentary convention and cannot be allowed to go unchallenged.

attributes.action: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.
attributes.background: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.
attributes.additional_details: It's everywhere in respected media outlets as well as American intelligence reports.

attributes.action: Urgently provide funding to schools to support children with SEND
attributes.background: We call on the Education Secretary to urgently boost special needs funding as there are currently thousands of children in the UK who have SEND who are without a school place.  This is an unnaceptable situation causing huge stress and anxiety for parents and their children.
attributes.additional_details:
https://schoolsweek.co.uk/hinds-challenged-over-dangerously-inadequate-send-funding/

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/councils-letter-damian-hinds-school-funding-children-special-needs-places-unions-a8403326.html

http://reports.ofsted.gov.uk/index.php?q=filedownloading/&id=2773973&type=1&refer=0

attributes.action: Increase funding for Bedfordshire Police to combat the rise in serious crime.
attributes.background: Bedfordshire is classified as a rural Police force, yet it has every major crime that larger cities such as Manchester, Birmingham and London have. Luton alone has an International Airport, Gun, Gang and knife crime, terrorism and hate crime, as well as a massive problem with anti social behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Officers in Luton are inundated with exceptional volumes of calls, to a point where they are unable to attend crimes in progress due to a lack of resources.
This has happened numerous times In the past 6 months, to a point where local residents do not report crime because they know Police will not attend.
Our own local Policing Team should have up to 10 officers, but due to cutbacks and lack of funding we are now down to 3, which is a reduction of 70%, and this is echoed across the county

attributes.action: Invest in M25 J5 sliproads to improve Kent’s quality of life & lessen pollution
attributes.background:
West Kent is severely harmed by traffic passing through because of no M26 / A21 connectivity at M25 J5.
Slip roads would improve toxic air pollution,safety,quality of life and business growth.UK Govt Road Investment Strategy 20-25 includes J5 Slips but no guarantee of investment to see them built.

attributes.action: Make PrEP available through the NHS across the whole of the country.
attributes.background: Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) is a life saving drug which prevents the contraction of HIV/AIDS. In the UK, only Scotland provides PrEP through the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand the government make PrEP available through the NHS across the country. It is a low-cost intervention - there is no excuse.

Use of PrEP reduces new HIV infections among men who have sex with men, heterosexuals, people who inject drugs. We were inspired by our MP publicly revealing his status in parliament on World Aids Day last week. 
 
PrEP is not only beneficial from a public health perspective, but also financially. It should be universally accessible across the UK.

attributes.action: Add a duty requiring MPs to act in the interest of their constituency's wildlife
attributes.background: Under the "Code of Conduct" MPs have a general duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole; and a special duty to their constituents. An additional special duty should be added requiring all MPs to act in the interests of their constituency's wildlife e.g. conserving biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is among the most nature-depleted countries in the world. 40% of all Britain's species are in moderate or steep decline. 1 in 5 British mammals are at risk of extinction.
 
There is widespread evidence that a better relationship with nature can improve our health and wellbeing as well as make our country more enjoyable to experience, beautiful and resilient.
 
It's time our country, with leadership from our MPs, forged a more caring relationship with their "wild constituents".

attributes.action: Social workers or Cafcass should have to record meetings with parents/children.
attributes.background: Currently caseworkers can deny making inappropriate comments, and there’s no way to uphold a complaint as a result. Requiring these meeting to be recorded will provide accurate evidence against the caseworker and likewise the caseworker would be supported if a vexatious case was made against them.
attributes.additional_details: Most importantly, this will help ensure that correct decisions are made about the care of our children.

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of Pheasants, Partridges and Grouse for sport.
attributes.background: 35 Million "game birds" are placed into the countryside annually for shooting, disrupting the environmental balance.  Native wildlife is killed to increase the number of game birds available for shooting. Damage to the environment and suffering to native species and to the game birds is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: The the introduction of a tens millions of non-native birds upsets the environmental balance of our countryside increasing competition, especially for food amongst native birds. Wildlife such as foxes, crows, magpies, badgers and weasels are directly or indirectly affected by shooting, snaring, trapping and illegal poisoning carried out by gamekeepers. Additionally, the loss of predator species does in itself further disrupt the local wildlife balance as species such as rodents can then thrive.
